title: "EFGB"

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
# install.packages("tidyverse")
# install.packages("plotly")
# put your libary loading here:
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
```

```{r}
ts <- read_csv("data/FGBdbv2_chlor_a_TS_MODA_daily_EFG.csv", col_types=cols())  # Pull CHL ts from .csv (need to fix source here to server, NOT Github!)

# convert dates
dates <- ts$Time %>%
    as.numeric() %>%
    as.POSIXct(origin = "1970-01-01", tz = "GMT")

# create plot
suppressWarnings(ggplot(ts, aes(x=dates, y=ts$mean)) + geom_point() +
    labs(
    x = "Time",
    y = "CHLa (mg m^-3)",
    colour = "Black"
  ))


```

## Time series plots

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this 

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
